channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Darius Boyd produced his best game of the season on Friday night against the Sharks. But the Broncos still found a way to lose and the veteran has had enough.
item.title: 'I’m sick of having to apologise': Broncos capitulation another blow for Boyd

item.description: We may have been rivals but sharing a flat with Terry Waters in the heady days of 1970 was a blast, writes Gareth Andrews.
item.title: My flatmate, the Collingwood captain: Terry Waters rises above the pack

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic is throwing up some major challenges for Australia, follow the latest developments here.
item.title: LIVE Coronavirus updates: Victoria records three deaths, 397 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, as aged care crisis continues; QLD border closes to Greater Sydney, Australian death toll jumps to 201

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Former UFC champion Robert Whittaker is back from Fight Island with a victory, and a renewed love of the sport.
item.title: Relaxed Whittaker says he's falling in love with UFC all over again

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A Victorian woman claiming to be transporting essential goods into Queensland has been charged with breaching public health orders.
item.title: Victorian accused of pretending to be 'essential' worker to cross border

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: James Murdoch's resignation letter was brutally succinct, making clear his departure was a rejection of the company's direction.
item.title: James Murdoch makes statement in the style of his dramatic departure

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: In an age where footballers have their programs planned to the minute, Sam Jacobs' training regime during lockdown was far from ideal.
item.title: Giant ruckman takes leaf out of Steve Smith's book during lockdown

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: Nicolai Muller was bleeding heavily, convulsing and out cold for several minutes on Friday night, but appears to have avoided serious injury.
item.title: Wanderers star escapes serious head injury after 'scary' collision

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: It has taken her a long time, but Melbourne Vixens defender Emily Mannix will play her 50th Super Netball game on Sunday.
item.title: 'Close to us not having a season': Mannix grateful for Super Netball's return

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Surfer Phil Mummert was lucky to get away with his life and limbs after a five-metre shark took "a few chunks out of his leg" on Friday.
item.title: 'He's doing great and singing Baby Shark': Support pours in for surfer mauled in WA's South West

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: One of the stranger features of this strange season has been the scarcity of dominating midfielders. In the absence of peak Cripps, Bont or Fyfe, the midfield positions were open for tenders.
item.title: No room for Cripps, Bontempelli or Fyfe in interim All-Australian team

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: Police Minister Lisa Neville has described the behaviour of Victorians who refuse to wear masks and breach lockdown orders as "appalling" after one Melburnian was caught driving to Wodonga for a McDonald’s Big Mac on Friday.
item.title: 'Appalling': Melbourne person fined after driving 320km for a Big Mac

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Nine people were detained, including two serving members and a former member of the Queensland Police Service.
item.title: Two Queensland cops suspended after drug raids

item.description: AFL round nine continues as footy fans enter day four of the festival of footy. First up, both North Melbourne and Adelaide will be desperate for a victory.
item.title: AFL Live Scores: North Melbourne v Adelaide

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Western United retain control of their own fate, but can ill afford any slip-ups against Newcastle on Sunday.
item.title: Western destiny in their own hands and determined to play finals

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Like Jack de Belin, Manase Fainu is in danger of being sidelined for a second season due to court delays despite pleading not guilty to his police charges.
item.title: Manly to urge NRL to review stand-down policy as Fainu awaits day in court

item.description: Microsoft is in talks to acquire TikTok, according to a person with knowledge of the discussions.
item.title: Trump says he plans to bar TikTok from operating in the US

item.description: Described by his NBA coach Gregg Popovich as a 'great citizen of the world', Patty Mills has again spoken of the racism he experienced growing up in Australia
item.title: 'The better I got, the worse the racism got': Aussie NBA star Mills

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: Find the number of active coronavirus cases in your postcode, as well as the total number of cases recorded in your area since the start of the pandemic.
item.title: Victoria coronavirus data: Find the number of active COVID-19 cases in your postcode

item.description: Australia's Minjee Lee has a share of fifth after the opening round of the LPGA Tour's first event back after the COVID-19 shutdown.
item.title: Lee in hunt, Kang takes early lead in Ohio as LPGA returns

item.description: The former world No.1 is in striking distance of American leader Brendon Todd halfway through the WGC-FedEx St. Jude Invitational in Tennessee.
item.title: Day six shots back as Todd takes lead in Memphis

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The woman, aged in her 30s, may have been unknowingly infectious during her last shift at the Bolton Clarke aged-care centre at Pinjarra Hills.
item.title: COVID-positive aged-care nurse may have worked shift while infected

item.description: The chief organiser of the Los Angeles Olympics says sport is not free of racism and wants to see athlete advocacy at the Games in eight years.
item.title: LA Olympic officials ask IOC to allow athlete protests

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Economists have praised the now expired emergency payments as the main reason many Americans have not fallen into poverty during the pandemic.
item.title: Millions in US face financial ruin as emergency jobless benefits end

item.description: The Dallas NFL franchise topped the annual Forbes list for the fifth year in a row after a 10 per cent revenue rise saw the Cowboys valued at almost $8 billion.
item.title: How 'bout them Cowboys: Dallas NFL franchise tops Forbes list again

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: Premier Daniel Andrews says he is poised to announce further restrictions in Victoria as concern increases around the levels of 'mystery' community transmission of COVID-19 in the state.
item.title: 'The numbers are too high': Premier poised to announce further restrictions as Victoria records 397 new cases, three deaths

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Sophie Craig has been forced to take leave without pay from her job for up to 14 weeks and says many players will struggle during the Super Netball season.
item.title: 'It will be a struggle': Players face big financial hit with Queensland hub move

item.description: The Kremlin insisted the men were private security guards who missed their flight. Belarus described them as mercenaries bent on fuelling unrest.
item.title: Kremlin denies Russians held in Belarus were insurrectionists

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: NSW Health revealed the COVIDSafe app helped identify two confirmed coronavirus cases and 544 possible contacts that it had not already traced.
item.title: Sydney's COVID-19 clusters grow as NSW records 17 new cases, one additional death

item.description: Drew Reid-Rowling, 12, was last seen in Darlington on July 24 and the Department of Communities said there were concerns for his wellbeing.
item.title: Concerns for Perth boy missing for six days

item.description: The rampant Lions were too good, too often, said Dons coach John Worsfold, with Brisbane now relishing the prospect of taking on reigning premiers Richmond.
item.title: Lions' savaging of Dons 'our best one for the year': Fagan

item.description: Critics say its purpose is to silence dissidents, arguing it signals the end of the "one country, two systems" deal made with Britain.
item.title: Hong Kong police target exiles living in UK

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The 35-year-old Mount Isa man accused of beating his partner and assaulting his young son was arrested after his alleged victims sought help at a farmhouse, police allege.
item.title: Man with seven guns in car chases wife and son as they flee attack

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: David Hutchinson has quit his job just hours after his former boss, Clive Palmer, announced he was running candidates in the October poll.
item.title: LNP president resigns as Palmer confirms his party will run in state election

item.description: Biden, the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee, initially said he'd select his running mate by August 1.
item.title: Biden delays naming of running mate until second week of August

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Garden City Shopping Centre is among 15 locations across Brisbane and Ipswich linked to the state's latest confirmed case of COVID-19.
item.title: New COVID alert for busy Brisbane shopping centre

item.dc:creator: Melissa Fyfe
item.description: Dan Andrews was at the top of his game: a masterful politician and popular premier with a bold agenda and knack for crisis leadership. Then COVID-19 came along.
item.title: Not happy, Dan: Victoria's Premier cops a pandemic pounding

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: James Murdoch has resigned from the News Corporation board of directors, citing "disagreements" about the company's editorial content.
item.title: James Murdoch resigns from News Corp board

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Thea Liddle's remains were found at a makeshift camp site during a two-day search of bushland near Tallow Beach Road in Byron Bay on July 14.
item.title: Human remains found in Byron Bay identified as missing woman Thea Liddle

item.description: A federal appeals court has tossed out the death sentence of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the man convicted in the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing.
item.title: Court overturns Boston Marathon bomber's death sentence

item.description: A 17-year-old was the "mastermind," state officials said, of a hack that turned into an embarrassment for Twitter and called into question the security provided by a range of tech companies.
item.title: Teenager charged as 'mastermind' of Twitter hack of politicians, celebrities

item.description: The talks come as TikTok's ownership by a Chinese company is under scrutiny from the White House and politicians.
item.title: Microsoft said to be in talks to buy TikTok as Trump weighs curtailing app

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Darling
item.description: Having been a fringe devotee since my teens, I am now embracing the swept-off-but-still-framing-the-face trend.
item.title: How to tame your curtain fringe

item.description: Jane Turner's story is familiar to psychologist Sarah McMahon, who says there are ways to curb the behaviour of eating as a way of bypassing feelings.
item.title: Jane engaged in emotional eating for years, until she got to the bottom of why

item.description: One of Britain's most successful directors, Parker's movies won 10 Academy Awards and 19 British Academy Film Awards.
item.title: Alan Parker, director of Midnight Express and Evita, dies at 76

item.description: More than 290,000 new coronavirus cases were recorded in the past day, a new record, with the biggest increases in the US, Brazil, India and South Africa.
item.title: WHO reports record daily increase in global coronavirus cases

item.description: "I count my blessings and urge you to keep wearing the damn mask, keep washing your hands, and stay socially distant," Cranston said.
item.title: 'Keep wearing the damn mask': Breaking Bad star Bryan Cranston had COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The thousands of people who raced back into Queensland before travel from Sydney was banned should self-isolate to protect the community, experts say.
item.title: Experts urge last-minute arrivals to isolate to prevent virus spread

item.description: A week in photos from the award winning Sydney Morning Herald and Australian Financial Review photographers
item.title: Photos of the week, July 30, 2020

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news
